data.text: @selkieO @UK_Centrist @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @elisaperego78 @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS @patientled Yes, I think @ahandvanish said their data show itâ€™s not uncommon for people to think they have recovered after acute Covid before #LongCovid symptoms emerge weeks or even months afterwards - many people may not realise their prolonged symptoms may relate to Covid

@UK_Centrist @selkieO @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS Yes, also I think continuous exposure to pandemic stress in the healthcare

@maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @amibanerjee1 @UnchartedWorlds @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @elisaperego78 @ahandvanish @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @ONS We feel the same. Our numbers have taken a sudden up turn 😞 

A preventable avoidable condition. 

The frustration is real. 

#LongCovidKids.

@TheendofdaysB @ClaireCozler @selkieO @UK_Centrist @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS I am very sorry to hear 💔 thanks for sharing this

@UK_Centrist @TheendofdaysB @ClaireCozler @selkieO @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS Yes. Very. And now we are on an ongoing reinfection process because governments want to declare the pandemic over

@elisaperego78 @ClaireCozler @selkieO @UK_Centrist @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS My mother had rheumatic fever as a child. It affected her heart. She died of cardiomyopathy from mitral valve stenosis. Parvovirus affected the hearts of puppies that caught it, causing myocarditis and other things. A lot died before they were 7 years old

@selkieO @UK_Centrist @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS Absolutely, even silent or minor disease can potentially lead to later severe events. "Symptoms" are just when you feel it; and symptoms go into studies when you report them, and the doctor write it down. A lot can be lost in translation, too. Shared!

@elisaperego78 @UK_Centrist @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS Which is exactly what you and I are worried about

@elisaperego78 @UK_Centrist @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS Yes but this is from a huge sample and likely includes many who don't have #LongCovid - they have 'silent' sequelae

@selkieO @UK_Centrist @Daltmann10 @amibanerjee1 @Know_HG @EthicalAfrica @profhelenward @Dr2NisreenAlwan @trishgreenhalgh @michael_zandi @kamleshkhunti @LongCovidSOS @LongCOVIDPhysio @long_covid @ahandvanish @maxwele2 @bcdelaney1 @JasmineHayer @LereFisher @Tim_R_Nicholson @ONS Oh yes you can have severe cardiovascular events in the first and second year. Many people I know including myself had. But I am also worry about basically everyone including asymptomatic children. It could be most of those infected with time?
Thanks I will read!
